reviews.review_msg: Curt's lectures were very enjoyable with all the guest lecturers. Get ready to write very long papers for this course but they are take home! The questions for the papers are clear and the TA was approachable for re-grading. The class however did seem disorganized with the TA dropping out of the course and the professor not responding to emails.

Dr. Griffiths is a fantastic professor. He's super kind and very approachable. You can chat with him about course content, and he's more than happy to explain things and discuss his research. If you can take a course with him, DEFINITELY DO! In my opinion, he's one of the best Crim professors at SFU - do yourself a favour and take a course with him

Curt brought in many guest speakers and we took a field trip to a prison. 4 short assignments and then the rest of the mark was participation. Only complaint is that grading is unclear for participation; I had an A+ in the assignments but somehow ended with an A- in the course, despite meaningfully participating and contributing in every class.

I took policing in Canada with Curt. He was a nice prof but the course consisted of primarily presentations from different members of law enforcement so I did not get to see him teach. We had two take-home exams as well as a tutorial presentation, responding in tutorials, and general participation. Pretty chill and was interesting.

By far one of the greatest professors at SFU. He is the only professor I've met that will make an effort to go up to his students during breaks and ask them about their semester and interest in the class. Genuinely compassionate individual with a lot of knowledge. Brings in lots of guest lecturers which made the course even more amazing.
had a lot of guest lectures which is what the papers were based on but this made the class more interesting learning from people with greater experience 10/10 experience

Curt is a great prof. I am graduating from SFU after this term and he is easily a top 3 professor I have ever had. The connections that he has in the policing world are incredible. He brought in guest speakers every week including several police chiefs. What you will learn in his class is incredible and it is no difficult at all.

Dr. Griffiths is a FANTASTIC professor! Hes top tier and a chill professor. He knows what hes talking about. When he does talk, youll never get bored since theres always something new to learn from him. Despite the many brief papers, you get a lot of value from the readings. His guest speakers add to the wonderful class experience as well.

Curt is an amazing professor & the course was enjoyable. A large part of your mark is participation so you need to come to class and contribute. There were 5 essay's, so quite a bit of reading for each of these because you need to reference the different articles. He is a completely fair marker and the guest speakers were very knowledgeable.

He is one of the best professor I ever had in my university life. His course is designed full of eye-opening and impressive contents that you can't get from other courses. He is very caring. Saying good morning to individual students is not a major thing nor related to the course, but certainly makes you feel welcomed.

To start off, Curt hands down one of the best profs at SFU. The 4 Brief notes in this class is okay. Participation is worth 40% so you have to talk and show up. There are a lot of guest speakers, and it is okay to challenge the guest speakers in this class, even though some may have a narrow mindset. Curt is all about discussion so dont be afraid.

Curt Griffiths is the best Professor in the SFU Criminology Department by far. Great guy that genuinely cares for the well-being of his students and wants them to excel. He's handled the COVID-19 scare during this semester professionally and compassionately. Thanks Prof Griffiths!

THE BEST PROF AT SFU HANDS DOWN! I have never met a professor so caring for his students in my entire life. This class is fun, interactive and interesting. The guest speakers were amazing and the briefing notes were a good overview for what you are learning. Overall he is amazing and I cannot stress that enough! Every prof needs to be like him!

Curt is hands down the best professor at SFU. I'm sad I didn't take his classes earlier on in my degree. He is a fair marker for briefing notes (which are worth 60% of your grade). He genuinely cares for his students.

I have just began taking the class with Dr. Griffith and I must say that I am really impressed. His style of teaching is definitely different from all the other professors; lots of involvement, guest speakers, fieldtrips. This is not an average crim class and Dr. Griffith is super intelligent and very very interesting to listen to. Recommend :)

Curt is the best prof I've ever had. Participation in class was worth 40 percent and 4 short writing assignments were worth 15 percent each. As long as you put in effort to participate in class and read what he tells you to for the writing components, you're golden.

Griffiths is passionate about his work. Even whilst taking an online course, you can see how much effort he puts in to educate students. If you take this course online, just make sure you answer the study questions per unit and you will do fine.

Amazing professor who has in-depth knowledge of the criminal justice system. Knows his stuff, focuses on the application and implementation within the criminal justice system instead of theories. Hands down best crim prof at SFU, would recommend 10/10, you will not be disappointed.
Absolutely great proff and great class! I would recommend anybody to take this course. offers a different learning opportunity with great guest speakers and shares his own working knowledge. 10/10

CRIM 410 was an awesome class, but only if you are willing to participate in class discussions on a weekly basis.  His class is structured very differently than most, but I found it was an enjoyable learning experience.  I would def take this course again!

such a great professor! class was structured brilliantly. discussions are so interesting. has a great sense of humour. communicates material in a relatable manner. amount of work for class is super reasonable! a must take for criminology students!!!

Pretty good course. Three papers (2,000 - 2,500 words each) with very clear criteria. Final exam was 40 MC and 10 SA questions based on the study questions. You were given 20 SA questions and only had to answer 10. The audio lectures were quite interesting as well.

Such a funny guy. Super friendly. Brought in a ton of guest speakers from different sectors of the CJS. You will be lucky if you get in this class. His briefing notes were marked a bit tough IMO, but still easy to do. Take this course you won't regret it.
Great lecturer, very interesting and an expert in the field. Exams also fairly easy.
Funny, intelligent, passionate. Makes going to class worth while.
Hands down, best prof at SFU. No exams. No textbooks - a few novels. A few opinion-based journal papers. Best learning experience. Just do it.
Curt is the greatest. He is laid back and easy going but still a great teacher. You will learn a lot from him and have a good time in any of his classes. One of the best crim professors at SFU

The guy knows what he's talking about, he wrote the book after all...however, seemed like his lectures involved more ranting with brief reviews of the material, his TA did more actual teaching. I learned alot more during tutorial's, highly recommend attending those besides the fact that they're mandatory

Curt is awesome, definitely an expert when it comes to policing and one of the best in the CRIM department. CRIM 455 consists of a number of briefing papers (summary of readings) almost each week, participation, and a final journal. Not a difficult class and I looked forward to attending each week. 4 classes were at VPD and weekly guest speakers.
Can't say enough nice things about him. He is easily the best professor in SFU's criminology department. I would take this same class every year with him if I could.

Attendance is mandatory because participation is a large portion of the course. No exams and there are just 4 journals with no limitation of what you can write. The field trip at the end of the semester is great. Interesting course that really opens your mind and gives you different perspective of the CJS.
Make sure you attend class and pay attention to videos and tutorial readings. Lectures are quite repetitive and boring.

Great Professor! Really opens your mind and changes how you think! Loved the readings in this class, and the field trip in the end was very eye-opening.. Definitely take a class with Curt you will not be disappointed!

great prof. he isn't very clear with regards to what exactly he wants for the papers, but at the same time it allows you to write whatever you want. we had 4 journals (65% total grade) and 35% participation - i think it should have been 80% + 20%. he's a very fair marker though. the prison trip at the end was great. recommended for sure!

a bit opinionated, but overall he is a good prof. no laptops allowed in class & no ppt slides are posted so you MUST go to class to take notes. a lot of his short answer questions on exams are from his lectures but mc questions are from his text.  this class is interesting, but too many videos are played during lectures so he doesnt teach sometimes

Has a wealth of knowledge on policing issues. Fun class with lots of field trips. Gives you a good opportunity to see policing in the real world and allows you to interact with Cops. Very informative class. Would definitely recommend this class or any one of Curt's other classes!

Can't think of a bad thing to say. He's smart, articulate, calculated, and his tests are very fair. His invitation of guest speakers to the classroom is quite useful. I also applaud his enforcement of no technology in the classroom (no use of laptops, cell phones etc), allows for a distraction-free class. He's great, try to take a class with him.
Best professor i've had at SFU so far. Was a pleasure to be in his course. Definitely recommend any course with him.

Great prof! very knowledgeable and interested in the topic of corrections. Makes every class interested by using examples from his career, bringing guests and movies. There are a couple of field trips in this class that are great. Very recommended.
Fantastic instructor- cares about his students and the work that he does

One of the best classes I have taken in SFU.  Curt really knows his stuff, and made the course material stimulating and thought provoking.  No exams, just assignments and participation.  Plus he baked us cookies!
Best prof. Very helpful, blunt and straight with you. Very informative and really allowed the class to learn something beyond textbooks and lectures.  Favorite prof from SFU so far!
no communication

I took CRIM 131 Distance Education and it was a great course. Griffiths provides his own textbook, a study guide, and a CD full of MP3 notes and interviews. Had to write 3 papers and write a final, all of which were fairly easy relative to other courses. Just stay ontop of the material and you will do great!
Best teacher I have taken and the best crim class I have taken. The field trips were fun and interesting.

Took him for crim 131 distance ed.  Seems like a fair and interesting prof. Crim 131 distance ed isnt that easy but its quite fair. Consisted of mostly papers and were marked a bit hard. Most people get B's on the papers, hard to get an A. I would take Griffiths again.
Great teacher... fun and interesting and informative.

Best teacher in the crim department and at SFU. Always makes time for his students especially if you are in your fourth year. If you are interested in policing this is the prof to keep in touch with he knows the ins and outs. Also make sure to take Crim 455 cause you will make great contact with VPD!

Best prof at sfu! Very easy and enjoyable class. He used his contacts to arrange great policing field trips for the class. Journal assignments were quite easy to do. Also, he is very funny and easy-going. Overall: 9/10

One of the best profs I've had. The workload is huge but if you do it you will do well. To the rater who believes that you can not do well unless you have one other class or fewer I had 4 others including 320 and 300 and still got an A+ in 410.

First class ever with Curt and it was great! not like the average prof that talks and talks, but Curt arranges great field trips for students to  learn from those in crim field. Gotta be the best Crim prof @ sfu. Used his policing textbook back at Douglas, should have him autograpgh it ;)
Best prof in out of the crim department. I have taken every class he teaches. Easy going very down to earth. Having a class with him is a MUST!!!!!!
He is a great teacher except the class requirments are so huge that you can't take more than 1 other class if you expect to do well in 410.
He is good

The class itself is amazing, field trips and guest speakers are an unforgettable experience. Curt never taught much though and when he did it was all about the parole board he is on and not corrections specifically. Go to lectures to see guests and take advantage of the trips!
Great class! No papers which was nice! He is a great teacher and the prison trips and class presentations were really helpful! Definitely a class worth taking!
Class was amazing. The field trips to the prisons were the best. Learn stuff that you would like to. Class is sort of boring, but the content and Curt are interesting. I think he has lived a lot.
Great proff. Used interesting speakers videos and field trips to teach the matterial. You learned with out meaning to it was one of the best expiriences
he is a good prof, exams were fair, but the book was boring. The field trips were amazing, I had the best time ever, learned a lot of different perspectives. he knows his stuff!
awesome field trips. midterms are fair and NO presentation or paper. Just great teacher who knows his stuff.

I can't believe some of the ratings on Prof Griffiths. This is one teacher who always made the class interesting and fun. His classes weren't the easiest I took during my BA but every class was insightful and made you want to actually read!
He wrote the book in this class, so he knows everything in it...no fooling. easy class, everything straight forward. fieldtrips very infomative.  He uses many methods of teaching, thus very useful.
best prof i ever had!!!! easy course
He has a good sense of humour and he knows a lot about Corrections. Course material is basic and straightford. Tests are straightford as well.

Hey Curt!  You were an awesome prof.  I greatly enjoyed the decision making class.  So much fun and learned a lot as well.  The trips into the real world really changed my perspective of how the CJS makes decisions.  Thanks so much.
Excellent prof, very interesting course, readings were by far the easiest reads of any course I took at SFU
One of the best profs I've ever had - interesting, dynamic, and a great teacher.  Highly recommended!
never around so hard to reach; overworks the TA; intimidating and explosive
Very nice and he made the class very interesting.  The field trips were awsome and his tests were easy as long as you read the text
he's alright! good presenter~~~
No Comments
No Comments
a good teacher, very nice
excellent attitude towards students, makes class very fun
